oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First Baptist Church Alamo: side
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of brick church's side. The building features three distinct sections: a gable-fronted vestibule, a gable-roofed main section with three bays of windows, and a rear section with two doors and two sash windows. A gravel lot sits next to the building.

The First Baptist Church of Alamo, Tennessee is a rural African American church. The historic building was remodeled in 1976 under the pastorate of Reverend E. L. Mabins. On November 4, 1984, the church cornerstone was laid by Celestial Lodge No. 80 of Humboldt, Tennessee. Reverend John Cole served as pastor at that time. The Central High School once stood behind the building. At the time of fieldwork, a park had replaced the former high school.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee; Baptist church buildings
